page.title: 01GRAINTHORPE
page.content: A large rural block which includes the hamlets of Eskham, Wragholme and Ludney. It lies astride the A.1031 road, bounded by Marshchapel to the North, Conisholme to the South, the Louth Navigation Canal to the West and the sea to the East. The area is flat, with fertile, silty soil to the east of the main road, but generally much heavier to the west. Chief crops are cereals and potatoes, and good grazing land. Its principle features are St.Clement's Church, Grainthorpe, at the S.E. corner, with its 14th century brass cross, to St. Mary's Church, Marshchapel, at the N.W. corner, with a monument to the Harpham family dated 1617. Deep reed lined dykes border most of the roads.
